results.title: Angelina Jolie Wants to Pick Up Where Warhol and Basquiat Left Off
results.abstract: The actress is building a community of artists, thinkers and doers of all kinds, in a storied building in downtown Manhattan.

multimedia.caption: At Atelier Jolie, meals — like this one, with dishes from Sudan, Venezuela and Syria — are part of the creative process. Angelina Jolie, shown with chefs and a resident curator and artist, has pivoted from fashion to art hub.

results.title: ‘Othello’ Review: Denzel Washington and Jake Gyllenhaal Are Prey and Predator
results.abstract: Shakespeare’s leanest tragedy gets a starry, headlong production that embraces the action but misses the mystery.

multimedia.caption: In a revival of “Othello,” at the Ethel Barrymore Theater, there has been a fascinating reversal: Jake Gyllenhaal’s Iago is far more legible than Denzel Washington’s title character.

results.title: Dag Solstad, 83, Dies; His Novels of Alienation Delighted Norwegians
results.abstract: A winner of top awards in his country, he drew the attention of European and American critics. The prime minister said he “made us see Norway and the world in new ways.”

multimedia.caption: The Norwegian author Dag Solstad in 2011. He created a bleak universe peopled by characters ill at ease with themselves and at odds with their surroundings.

results.title: Fred Eversley, Sculptor of Otherworldly Discs, Is Dead at 83
results.abstract: With his engineering background, he thought about his work differently from how other artists did. His abiding interest was in energy, in the scientific sense.

results.title: Brian James, Pioneer of Punk Rock, Is Dead at 70
results.abstract: As the guitarist and main songwriter for the Damned, he helped spark an explosion on the British music scene in the 1970s.

multimedia.caption: The guitarist and songwriter Brian James at his home in London in 1980. The Damned, which he formed in 1976, was part of Britain’s original punk vanguard.

results.title: Marty Callner, Director of Comedy Specials and Music Videos, Dies at 78
results.abstract: At HBO in the late 1970s, he established the template for presenting stand-up on the small screen. He then became a mainstay of MTV in its early days.
